description: From immortal +â€Ž -ise. Perhaps modelled on Middle French immortaliser.

verbs.description: immortalise (third-person singular simple present immortalises, present participle immortalising, simple past and past participle immortalised) (Non-Oxford British English, transitive)

entries.meaning: To give unending life to, to make immortal.

examples: His heroic deeds were immortalised in song and tale.
